propDescriptions.animation: The animation. If false the animation effect is disabled.
propDescriptions.children: Optional children to infer width and height from.
propDescriptions.classes: Override or extend the styles applied to the component. See CSS API below for more details.
propDescriptions.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propDescriptions.height: Height of the skeleton. Useful when you don't want to adapt the skeleton to a text element but for instance a card.
propDescriptions.sx: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles. See the `sx` page for more details.
propDescriptions.variant: The type of content that will be rendered.
propDescriptions.width: Width of the skeleton. Useful when the skeleton is inside an inline element with no width of its own.

root.description: Styles applied to the root element.

withChildren.description: Styles applied when the component is passed children.

fitContent.description: Styles applied when the component is passed children and no width.

heightAuto.description: Styles applied when the component is passed children and no height.
